news.title: Derabassi builder, revenue staffer under SIT lens in fake NOCs scam
news.para: Their names were revealed by the arrested accused — Gulshan Kumar of ward number 18 and Suresh Kumar of ward number 15 in Derabassi — during their custodial interrogation.

news.title: About 1.25 crore families to get ownership rights of land by Dec 2023: Uttar Pradesh CM
news.para: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said, "75 lakh families in the state were given possession of the land where they reside. By December 2023, 1.25 lakh families of Uttar Pradesh will be given ownership rights of leased land under the PM SVAMITVA Yojana."

news.title: Godrej Landmark Redevelopers receives order for GST demand worth Rs 129.39 crore
news.para: The GST order is over alleged non-payment of GST in relation to one of the project developed by Godrej Landmark Redevelopers in Mumbai.

news.title: WeWork's chief operating officer to step down
news.para: WeWork has been in turmoil ever since its plans to go public in 2019 imploded as investors worried over its hefty losses and began to doubt its business model of taking long-term leases and renting them for the short term.

news.title: Gurugram: 50 illegal colonies demolished in DTCP crackdown
news.para: District town planner Binesh Kumar identified 14 illegal colonies in Sohna and Bhondsi area which were built violating the Haryana Urban Development Act, 1975. These colonies were being developed on 41 acres of agricultural land.

news.title: Mumbai builder sent to judicial custody in Rs 4 crore flats scam
news.para: Meanwhile, additional sessions judge KG Paldwar on Thursday dismissed the anticipatory bail pleas of two other builders including a retired assistant commissioner, income tax Sunita Joshi, and another Mumbai-based builder Bhavesh Jain.

news.title: Adani Group set to refinance $3.5 billion debt taken for ACC-Ambuja buy
news.para: At least 18 global banks have agreed to join the consortium led by Barclays, Deutsche Bank and Standard Chartered among others, for refinancing the debt that helped fund the biggest M&A in India’s building-materials industry.

news.title: UK: Barratt flags 'uncertain' outlook amid tough mortgage market
news.para: The UK's largest homebuilder reiterated annual home building targets would be 20% lower than last year as affordability issues, stoked by expensive mortgages and a prolonged cost-of-living squeeze, pummel demand in the sector.

news.title: Sagar Cements posts net loss of Rs 10.53 crore in Q2 FY24
news.para: Sagar Cements' net consolidated total income stood at Rs 589.56 crore in Q2 FY24, a growth of 20.45 per cent from Rs 489.48 crore it recorded in the similar quarter last year.

news.title: China's new home prices extend declines, defying broader recovery
news.para: New home prices fell 0.2% month-on-month but narrowed from a 0.3% drop in August, according to Reuters calculations based on National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data. Prices were down 0.1% from a year earlier, matching August's decline.

news.title: Havells India's net profit increases by 33.19% in Q2 FY24
news.para: Havells India's net consolidated total income stood at Rs 3,952.81 crore, a growth of 6.17 per cent from Rs 3,723.26 crore it recorded in the similar quarter last year.

news.title: Faering Capital invests $30 million in Vastu Housing Finance
news.para: Vastu, an affordable housing finance company, has assets under management (AUM) of US$900 million and has presence in 15 states across India. The company reported profit after tax of over Rs 285 crore in FY23.

news.title: Swiss elevator maker Schindler expects 2023 revenue growth of 6-8%
news.para: Full-year net profit is expected to reach 880 million to 910 million Swiss francs ($979 million-$1.01 billion) and revenue to grow 6% to 8% in local currencies, Schindler said. The company previously aimed for revenue growth of 5% to 8% and net profit of 860 million to 900 million francs.

news.title: Country Garden says founder, board chairperson at work, haven't left China
news.para: Founder Yeung Kwok Keung quit Country Garden's board in March and daughter Yang Huiyan became chairperson. Yeung remains a special adviser.

news.title: Ultratech Cement's net profit up 68.76% in Q2 FY24
news.para: Ultratech Cement's total consolidated income stood at Rs 16,179.26 crore in Q2 FY24, a growth of 15.25 per cent from Rs 14,038.95 crore it recorded in the similar quarter last year.

news.title: NFRA penalises auditor for lapses in Sobha audit case
news.para: The order came after NFRA received information from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) vide a letter dated May 2021 against Sachdev for professional and other misconduct in the statutory audit of Sobha for FY 2017-18 and 2018-19.

news.title: PropShare Capital launches second fund PREF II; plans to raise Rs 500 crore
news.para: PREF II is targeting to raise Rs. 500 crores with a further Rs. 200 crore green shoe option. It will focus on completed Class A income-generating commercial real estate leased to multinational and blue-chip tenants in the tech hubs of India.

news.title: ED arrests Pushpanjali Realms' director on charges of cheating, duping flat buyers
news.para: ED initiated an investigation on the basis of an FIR registered by Rajpur PS, Dehradun against Pushpanjali Realms and lnfratech, its directors and others under various sections of IPC for cheating and duping the innocent flat buyers after taking advance payments for booking of flats in respect of construction projects of the Company.

news.title: Jharkhand government gives nod to ambitious Rs 16,320 crore housing project for needy
news.para: ​Two lakh people will be provided houses in the ongoing fiscal, followed by 3.5 lakh in the next fiscal and 2.5 lakh in the financial year 2025-26 at an expenditure of Rs 4,107 crore, Rs 7,107 crore and Rs 5,107 crore respectively, an official said.

news.title: Ludhiana: Atal Apartments project lingers on, allottees see red
news.para: Even tenders issued for the construction of a community centre and multi-storey parking, included in the scheme, have been put on hold. Unable to give reasons for the delay, officials mere say that the work will begin soon.
